com.characterforming.jrte

Interface ITransduction

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ITarget

    public interface ITransduction
extends ITarget
    Interface for runtime transductions. A transduction binds an IInput stack, transducer stack, and an ITarget instance. When the run() method is called the transduction will read input ordinals from the IInput on the top of the input stack and invoke the effectors triggered by each input transition until one of the following conditions is satisfied:
    1. the input stack is empty
    2. the transducer stack is empty
    3. an effector returns RTE_PAUSE
    4. an exception is thrown
    As long as the input and transducer stacks are not empty it may be possible to call the run() method again after it returns if, for example, the pause effector causes the previous call to return or a DomainErrorException was thrown and you want to persevere after driving the input to a recognizable location (eg, end of nearest containing loop).

    Domain errors (inputs with no transition defined) are handled by emitting a nul signal, giving the transduction an opportunity to handle it with an explicit transition on nul. For most text transducers, domain errors can be avoided entirely by transducing the transducer. For example, with line-oriented text, all possible interleavings of domain errors in the input can be modeled by replacing each non-nl input (x) with (x|nul) in the original transducer definition. The resulting transducer can then be pruned to produce a hardened transducer that accepts ((any - nl)* nl)* and silently resynchronizes with the input after a domain error. If a domain error occurs on a nul signal, a DomainErrorException is thrown.

    IInput.get() will return null and force eos whenever it is called after the last input ordinal is returned from the input stack. Transducers can explicitly handle this by including a transition on eos. If eos is not explicitly handled the transduction will simply stop and (status() will return STOPPED).

    Author:
    kb

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int PAUSED
      Transduction is paused, waiting for input; will be runnable when input is available
      static int RUNNABLE
      Transduction is runnable when status() == RUNNABLE
      static int STOPPED
      Transduction is not runnable because transduction stack is empty

      • start

        void start(java.lang.String transducer)
    throws RteException
        Set up or reset a transduction with a specified transducer at its start state on top of the transducer stack. To process input, call the input(IInput[]) method.
        Parameters:
        transducer - The name of the transducer to start
        Throws:
        GearboxException - On error
        TransducerNotFoundException - On error
        RteException - On error

      • input

        Set up transduction inputs.
        Parameters:
        inputs - Initial (or additional) inputs in LIFO order, inputs[0] is last out
        Throws:

      • run

        int run()
 throws RteException
        Run the transduction with current input until the input or transduction stack is empty, or an effector returns RTE_PAUSE, or an exception is thrown.
        Returns:
        Run status of transduction at point of return
        Throws:
        DomainErrorException - On error
        EffectorException - On error
        InputException - On error
        RteException - On error
        See Also:
        status()

      • status

        int status()
        Test the status of the transduction's input and transducer stacks.
        Status Description
        STOPPED Transduction stack is empty.
        PAUSED Transduction stack not empty, input stack empty.
        RUNNABLE Transduction stack not empty, input stack not empty.

        A paused transduction can be resumed by calling run() when new input becomes available in the input stack. Transducers may deliberately to break out of run() with transducer and input stacks not empty and allow the caller to determine future course, in which case transduction can be run() again immediately as long as status() == RUNNABLE.

        Returns:
        Transduction status
